page.title: 19ORIGIN OF LOCAL PLACE NAMES
page.content: {Burbage(Burbach) {________________ Bur = Hill Bach = Spring Burbage is on a hill and there are underground springs. {Aston Flamville {_______________ The manors of Aston, Burbage and Sketchley were given to Robert de Flamville by the Queen in 1100 AD. {Mickle Hill,Aston Flamville {___________________________ 'Mickle' is an Archaic word meaning 'much' or 'great'. The meaning for Mickle Hill is 'Big Hill' {Sharnford(Scerne Forde) {_______________________ From the old English 'Scearn' meaning 'muddy' Ford.
